DataElement.preferredName: Transplantation Psychosocial Assessment of Candidates for Transplantation Assessment Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species._A tool to address psychosocial risks in transplant recipients. It consists of an 8-item rating scale with four sections: social support, psychological health, lifestyle factors, and understanding of transplant and follow-up. The instrument can also capture the clinicians assessment of a patients substance abuse, compliance, and coping strategies. The overall impression of the patients suitability for transplantation is assigned a final PACT score._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

It consists of an 8-item rating scale with four sections: social support, psychological health, lifestyle factors, and understanding of transplant and follow-up. The instrument can also capture the clinicians assessment of a patients substance abuse, compliance, and coping strategies. The overall impression of the patients suitability for transplantation is assigned a final PACT score.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The grafting of tissues from one individual to another or place to place within a single individual.

Concepts.definition: Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.

Property.preferredName: Psychosocial Assessment of Candidates for Transplantation
Property.preferredDefinition: A tool to address psychosocial risks in transplant recipients. It consists of an 8-item rating scale with four sections: social support, psychological health, lifestyle factors, and understanding of transplant and follow-up. The instrument can also capture the clinician's assessment of a patient's substance abuse, compliance, and coping strategies. The overall impression of the patient's suitability for transplantation is assigned a final PACT score.

Concepts.longName: Psychosocial Assessment of Candidates for Transplantation
Concepts.definition: A tool to address psychosocial risks in transplant recipients. It consists of an 8-item rating scale with four sections: social support, psychological health, lifestyle factors, and understanding of transplant and follow-up. The instrument can also capture the clinician's assessment of a patient's substance abuse, compliance, and coping strategies. The overall impression of the patient's suitability for transplantation is assigned a final PACT score.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Changed from caBIG to PhenX for PANH by script 2015-12-21

ReferenceDocuments.name: PQT
ReferenceDocuments.description: The Psychosocial Assessment of Candidates for Transplantation (PACT) includes eight questions that focus on four domains: social support, psychological health, lifestyle factors, and understanding of transplant and follow-up. Each question is rated from 1 to 5, with a higher score indicating more positive psychosocial status. The PACT also includes initial and final ratings based on the interviewer's impressions of whether the candidate should be accepted for transplant. Scoring instructions are included.
